-e ---

𓅱 𓍢 𓏲 eə Letter 'ⲱ' similar to 'ũ' 'uu' 'w' 'wə' 'wo' 'wn' 'un' 'ən' µ < rwn/rvm 𓏲=Ⲣ=ⲣ=100 / pwn / cen

𓅱 ≠ 󳰎 󳰏 󳰐 󳰑 󳰒 󳰓 󳰔 Subtleties

𓅱 ⲉⲣϫⲱ ↔ ⲉⲣϫ ⇔ 𓄿 *h₃érō որոր oror 𒄩𒀀𒊏𒀸 ḫāras Hittite
𓅱 ὄρνις órnis “bird, chicken” => ornitology 𓄿 Aar Arn Arne ǫrn earn erne ὄρνεον órneon

𓅱 ≈ 𒎌 ≈ 𒈨𒌍 -men plural

𓅱 WR <? 𒀫 būru born "son, descendant" ⇔ calf; young, youngster, chick > pollo

𓅱𓍢𓏲 WR/WN wren? pinto?
𓅱𓍢𓏲 rum ru-um @ Elamite > Rhvn > Huhn?
𓅱 ⲉⲣϫⲱ ↔ ⲉⲣϫ (chicken)
𓅱𓀀 own wo 我 we (wir,man)
𓅱 Huhn/Hen/հավ/hɑv/Hahn/hin/ayin 𓅱 ه م ⇔
𓅱 hundert 100
𓅱 often used for ə 𓍢𓏲 wav<wind/wound/round :
𓅱 -ⲩ plural
𓅱 ⋍ 𓏲=Ⲣ=ⲣ=100 (russian Ⲣ=R, not p) ရာ (vs 100=ϣⲉ⋍shə⋍cent)
𓅱𓂜 un- negating prefix ➙ UN- AN- ENT- 𓅱 Anti- 𓂜 um- mo- ma- negation
𓅱 Wachtel⋍VVogel V Vau Waw fowl ⋍ 乌 Wū
𓅱 wo, who, whon, whom, when, von reflexives / pronouns
𓅱 -vr/-vn plural marker: child ⇨ children

w < p ?

𓅱 pollo pollino pollito 🐥 🐣 who
🐔 gallo 🐤 gallina peculiar que

𓐍𓆑𓅱 Khafra Khufu=Cheops Suphis Chnoubos dedicated to the god Khnum

𓊪𓅱/𓏏𓅱 wihin, tihin @ Berber
𓊪𓅱/𓏏𓅱 way, tai (this)
𓊪𓅱/𓏏𓅱 win, tin (that)
𓊪𓅱/𓏏𓅱 wan, tan
𓅱 ayin one

Consistent soundchange to ya in Hausa
𓅱𓏮 yaya@Hausa = how
𓏏𓅱 ɗaya = one

𔒚 𓅱 #avis •awᵘˢ bird
𔒞 𓄿 #aquila Aar eagle

-𓅱 -er -ler person suffix :
𓐩 𓏌 𓏥 | flour | Mehl
𓐩 𓏌 𓅱 | miller | 𒊩𒆳𒄯 geme₂ara₃

𓅱 ANfang & ENde Ente < WENDE 𓍢𓏲
𓅱 𓈙 𓃀 𓀁 ansba answer < 𐌰𐌽𐌳𐌰𐍅𐌰𐌿𐍂𐌳𐌴 antawaurde anti-vaurde Antwort
𓅱 Ente ⋍ ante 𐌰𐌽𐌳𐌰 ubiquitous prefix + suffix!

𓅱 ent- prefix entkommen : 𓅱 𓉔 𓂢 escape (un-/out-/ex-home)

𓅱 ≠ 󳰎 󳰏 󳰐 󳰑 󳰒 󳰓 󳰔
Egyptian is known to exhibit very similar but different signs.
Subtleties matter and might have been lost in translation:

𓅱 as prefix is elusive and ambivalent
While 𓅱 as infix or suffix is ᵂR, as prefix its important component is Wʳ < µPʳ !
𓅱 µPʳ > PH > B/F > V > W > U
𓅱 𓄊 𓋴 𓂋 | powerful
𓅱 𓂝 𓃂 | pure
𓅱 𓂝 𓂋 𓂾 𓂻 | flight | firr@Kurd > उड़ान uṛān
𓅱 𓂝 𓄯 | follow
𓅱 𓏏 𓆃 | < feather 𓆄 𓅱 𓏏 𓆃
𓅱 𓂝 𓆑 𓀜 | bend
𓅱 𓏏 𓎫 | bind, bandage
𓅱 𓏏 𓍿 | beget | ⇔ birth
𓅱 𓂧 𓆑 𓂻 | wait
𓅱 𓏏 𓊡 | wind
𓅱 𓂧 𓃀 𓄲 𓂻 | wend
𓅱 𓎼 𓎼 | weak(ness)
𓅱 𓎼 𓎱 𓇳 | Wag festival (a religious festival)
𓅱 𓎼 𓄿 𓇋 𓆭 | jaw | فَكّ fakk
𓅱 𓂧 𓏴 𓂡 | put / implant
𓅱 𓂸 𓏏 𓏛 | phat™ (thick) vs Mast vs round
𓅱 𓐍 𓂧 𓐖 𓏛 | forbear | 𐍆𐍂𐌰𐌱𐌰𐌹𐍂𐌰𐌽 frabairan “to endure” ?
𓅱 𓂸 𓏏 𓏏 𓊅 | thick wall | baut > حيط ḥēṭ ⇔ wattle & daub
𓅱 𓃀 𓇱 | wound | PIE *bʰerH- pierce > ferīta vs •rebna > rána
𓅱 𓃀 𓈖 𓏌 𓌙 𓉐 | wound | ← bane, pain, bend
𓅱 𓂝 | UN⇔FL:FALSCH ne PAS 𓅱𓂝 不 bù 别 bié 未 wèi 罔 wǎng 无 wú 弗 fú 非 fēi Unfug

complete old form either rwn, bwn, mwn, mwk/ckwn>chn ϣⲉ še ਸੌ sau سل sël >hn=100 ehun ἑκατόν

strange prefix M-

complete old form probably with leading 'm' ⋍ mwn/mwr < µPʳ :
𓅱;mwn-; negating greek prefix μo- mei¬ 没 manu-𓂜 𓅱mini- vs 𓅱 un¬ bu¬ ab¬ bes¬
𓅱;moi/we;I compare ani ante-I
𓅱;mia; 𒈨 ME 100 𐤌𐤀𐤕 מֵאָה me'á 100 مية miyya vs mille=1000 មួយរយ muəy rɔɔy ១០០ = 1*100 ܡܐܐ
𓅱;meier; 100 guilder banknote (now 100€) מאה meye מֵאָה me'á ma•wir µ•wr
𓅱;men; -plural מם -im 𒎌 -mes 𒈨𒌍 moons
𓅱;من man من min "mine" Persian / Kurdish 𓅱

Further hints at the dangling vr:
𓇋 𓊪 𓅱 ⋍= 𓇋 𓊪 𓆑 who, wer

Further hints at the dangling 'n':
𓋴 𓅱 𓎛 𓏏 𓆱 | coffin | صُنْدُوق ṣundūq צנדוק ṣəndūq “coffer” ultimately σῠνθήκη sunthḗkē
𓇋 𓊪 𓅱 ⋍= 𓇋 𓊪 𓈖 wen,wem,welche(r/s) these
𓊏 𓊪 𓅱|sphinx| sppvn
𓊪 𓏤 𓅱 𓊖||(pl.) gods of Pe| 百 bǎi 𓅱𓊖⋍ntr (common reading of 'god'), 𓅱𓊖 ⋍ AN𒀭 , Ahnen
𓎡 𓄿 𓅱|carun|green
𓍲 𓈖 𓍿 𓅱 𓀁|zanken|strife, quarrel| -en vs -ier@Franken 𓅱⋍𓏲=Ⲣ
𓎼 𓎼 𓅱 𓏮 𓁻|gucken|stare| 𓅱 Kücken chick-hen 鸡cui 隹zhuī jī

A hundret words hint at the existence of a dangling 'n' in the letter 𓅱 (think french plural -ons).
If one accepts this, at least as axiom, you get the reading:

𓃟 Shu+w 𓆄𓅱𓃟 sow, full reading:
𓃟 Shu+wn 𓆄𓅱𓃟 swine
𓆷 swamp ⇔ swines 𓆷𓄿𓂸𓃟 sphaines ⇔ 𓂸 Span Ferkel

𓅱 niǎo 鸟 𓈖𓉔𓏮𓅪no⋍null 𓂜 𓈖𓉔𓅱𓏮𓀀𓏥 nyouth 𓈙𓂋𓇋𓅪 small, little
𓅪 nich 𓈖𓐍𓅪 niedlich 𓈖𓆓𓋴𓅪 'niedshe' 𓇛 naschen
𓅱 µω/ωµ mü micro 𓈖𓐍𓅪 vs niǎo 鸟 𓈖𓇋𓅱𓅦 mini 𓅱𓅪
vs

Eastern Branch:
𓅱⋍𓍢𓏲⋍ρϱ Rhoun = hundert:100 rand
𓍢𓏲 róng 绒 = down feather, pruinose
𓍢𓏲 róng 茸 柔 róu = soft VS roh,rau,raw,rough (¬ crude coarse gross)
𓍢𓏲 round, ridj, ring vs 𓌗𓍵𓍶𓋪𓏸𓏌

𓅱 rebhuhn (sic) 𓅱 𓈙 𓃀 = rw.s.bein = response
